description:
As a Smashing Boxes Product Director, you ensure our clients and projects are always moving in a positive, successful direction. Within our walls you are your client, meaning: you represent their vision and best interests to our teams and all of SB. However, this doesn’t mean you do whatever clients ask of you. You have the responsibility of asking them the hard questions that challenge their thinking. And you aren’t afraid to tell them when something they want might be a bad idea for their product. However, you do this with good reason, grace and by offering alternative solutions because you never leave them feeling like you don’t have their back.

You are also accountable to your teams. Partnering with project managers, your new best friend at SB, you are responsible for ensuring teams get what they need from clients in a timely manner to deliver the best work possible. And just as you have the client’s back, you also have your team’s back. You walk a fine line between the two, but this isn’t your first rodeo – you manage this split-personality requirement with ease.

On a daily basis, you are constantly on the lookout for ways to provide new value to your accounts. So much value that our clients should eventually feel they can't manage without you as a part of your team. At the end of each engagement, clients often come back to work with us again not just because we deliver amazing products, but because they want you to still be thinking about their business more so than their own team members. You represent and deliver quality, thoroughness and intelligent efficiency.


Other Responsibilities Include:

  • Running internal project kick-off meetings to ensure the project teams are briefed and prepared to kick-off the project with our clients
  • Running client kick-off meetings to ensure our clients and project teams are aligned on the project direction, expectations and delivery process
  • Owning the Discovery phases of your assigned projects to ensure we collect or create the necessary information for our teams to be successful (project brief, product vision, goals and KPIs, requirements, unique value proposition, personas, product canvas, etc.)
  • Consulting with clients to create and maintain their product roadmap, creating the product backlog, fielding and prioritizing new feature requests and writing user stories, confirming when our work meets the definition of “done”
  • Overseeing your assigned projects to ensure the work remains on strategy, on budget and of the highest quality
  • Partnering with Project Managers to help solve day-to-day account issues as needed
  • Working closely with project managers, UX, UI, and developers to advise on project direction, deliverables and overall approach to meet our clients goals
  • Joining weekly status meetings with your Project Manager and clients
  • Creating and maintaining client-specific documentation to help team members understand the client environment (client org charts, contact lists, etc.)
  • Nurturing your client relationships to uncover new opportunities to grow their business or obtain referrals
  • Using monitoring tools to scan blogs, forums and social media on a daily basis for anything about your client’s business, industry, competitors, etc., that could be relevant to our work together
  • Tracking / understanding emerging audience behaviors, technologies, and companies that have the potential to impact our client’s businesses
  • Partnering with UX and Growth Engineering to design and conduct any necessary research plans
  • Partnering with Growth Engineering and UX to conduct competitive analysis for clients and identifying gaps and opportunities in the marketplace
  • Utilizing the proper frameworks, tools and approaches to facilitating strategic and creative work sessions with clients and teams to help solve problems and define and prioritize product features and functionality
  • Co-author case studies or related blog posts for your assigned projects
  • Participating in business development and sales opportunities as needed
  • Contributing to thought leadership activities and company blog
  • Fostering a collaborative, team-oriented teaching/learning environment
